intro: Cathartolinum muelleri, commonly known as the Mueller's cathartolinum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
